title.narrative: Improving and sustaining the capacity of wildlife guards to protect the Okapi Wildlife Reserve, DR Congo

description.narrative: This grant provides support for protected area operations at the Okapi Wildlife Reserve in the Democratic Republic of Congo. This protected area, a World Heritage Site, has suffered from regional instability and poaching incursions by armed entities. Previous support has allowed the improvement of infrastructure for ranger staff and expansion of patrol intensity and coverage. Specific activities will include operational support for wildlife guards from the national wildlife authority (Institut Congolais pour la Conservation de la Nature) and the provision of two new satellite phones to improve connectivity and communication.

description.narrative: U.S. assistance to the Republic of the Congo (Congo) focuses on promoting regional peace and security in this post-conflict country. Boasting Central Africa's only deep water port, the Congo's financial capital of Pointe-Noire maintains its International Ship and Port Facility Security (ISPS) certification. This certification creates significant economic opportunity for the Congo - which seeks to turn the coastal city into a regional shipping hub - while requiring a modern, professional security posture in accordance with strict ISPS standards. To help promote this growth and encourage regional stability, U.S. foreign assistance focuses on development of the Congo's professional military capabilities and provides foundational training for development in this area, in keeping with post's Integrated Country Strategy.
